alert.note: Alert for Panola (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 06 at 2:31AM CDT until April 09 at 7:00AM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 530 AM CDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of northwest Louisiana and northeast Texas, including the following county and parishes, in northwest Louisiana, Bossier, Caddo and De Soto. In northeast Texas, Panola. * WHEN...Until 530 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 231 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Shreveport, Bossier City, Carthage, Haughton, Greenwood, Benton, Stonewall, Logansport, Fosters, Eastwood, Gary City, Keachi, Longstreet, Spring Ridge, Keithville, Kickapoo, Keat Chie, Gloster, Cross Lake and Forbing. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
